intro: Bothriocline katangensis, commonly known as the Katanga daisy, is a flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, hairy leaves and produces showy yellow to orange flower heads. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
